results.title: Mozart in Salzburg
results.creator_credit: Barrie Gavin, Francis Hitching, Profilm and Francis Hitching Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Composers”.
Biographical film on the life of one of the world’s greatest composers, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, born in 1756 in Salzburg, Austria. The brilliance and genius of Mozart is still appreciated and interpreted today by musicians worldwide. Features the Salzburg Mozarteum Orchestra in this specially staged concert program, conducted by Ralph Weikert and distinguished broadcaster and musicologist Antony Hopkins who provides an introduction to each concert piece, including a brief account of Mozart’s life from childhood to adulthood.

results.title: Beethoven
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Marre and Anvil Films and Record Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Composers”.
This film deals with Beethoven’s music up to 1806. John Ogden at the piano plays the “Appassionata” from the “Tempest Sonata” and with Brenda Lucas the early “Sonata for four hands”. Von Karajan conducts Symphony no. 3 (the “Eroica”) op. 55 and the Gabrielli Quartet plays “Rasoumoffsky Quartet” no.2 op.59.

results.title: The Find of '93
results.creator_credit: R.H. Miller and Southern Cross Newsreels
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Golden West Series”.
Paddy Hannan’s find in 1893 led to the development of Kalgoorlie. Over 28 million ounces of fine gold have been taken from the “Golden Mile’s” open cut and deep mines. Demonstrates the mining process from power drilling of the ore bearing rock to crushing, screening and grinding of the ore. Washing and treating before processing in flotation cells, storage before smelting and finally the bullion is produced ready for the last smelting at the Royal Mint.

results.title: True Australians
results.creator_credit: R.H. Miller and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Golden West Series”.
Filmed in the Jarrah and Karri forests of Western Australia, shows the felling of trees and transport by whim and rail to the mill. Aspects of reafforestation and fire control are also shown. Historically interesting film in light of when it was produced (1948) and the current debate in the year 2000 surrounding the logging of these forests in Western Australia.

results.title: Down River
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
For some, floods are a disaster, for others a necessary lifegiving event. The quite different ecology of the riverland is explored in this Gippsland Victoria series, which gives an insight into the Gippsland region and the full scope of natural phenomenon

results.title: Through the Forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
One of a series of films about Gippsland, which gives an insight into this region and shows the full scope of natural phenomenon. The Mountain Ash provides food and shelter at all levels. From the forest floor where the lyrebird scavenges to the treetops which provide launch pads for the spectacular sugar gliders

results.title: Open to the Sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
One of a series of films about Gippsland, which gives an insight into this region and shows the full scope of natural phenomenon. Where the river meets the sea, new designs in environmental geography appear
